intro: Heiseria, commonly known as goldenroot, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to North America. The plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. Heiseria species produce yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late summer or early autumn. These plants are often found in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes.
